abstract.p: Christina T Savas letter on Jesse Green's Sept 15 article on shortcomings of AIDS-prevention programs aimed at gay men; photo (S)

block.p: Having sex without a condom is a choice Mark Ebenhoch chooses to make. His behavior is not due to ''inadequate'' AIDS awareness campaigns. He's an educated man, not a ''victim.'' You don't have to be perfect to protect yourself from AIDS, just responsible.

People his age (my age), gay and straight, know what it takes to avoid AIDS. Using a condom isn't spontaneous? No kidding. But we expect responsible adults to do what they have to do to prevent the spread of sexually transmitted diseases.

Having sex without a condom is a choice Mark Ebenhoch chooses to make. His behavior is not due to ''inadequate'' AIDS awareness campaigns. He's an educated man, not a ''victim.'' You don't have to be perfect to protect yourself from AIDS, just responsible.

People his age (my age), gay and straight, know what it takes to avoid AIDS. Using a condom isn't spontaneous? No kidding. But we expect responsible adults to do what they have to do to prevent the spread of sexually transmitted diseases.

As for Walt Odets's comments that heterosexuals get the message that they can dispense with condom use after the partners' H.I.V.-negative status is confirmed -- come on! Once a gay couple's H.I.V.-negative status is confirmed, and they decide to enter into a long-term, monogamous relationship, who said the same rules can't apply?
Why try to pit gay men, lesbians and heterosexuals against one another on this issue? For the record, we're all scared.
